run off.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to leave a place or person in a way that people disapprove of
run off.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Amy’s husband had run off and left her with two children to bring up.
run off.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to quickly print several copies of something
run off.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I’ll run off a few more copies before the meeting.
run off.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to force someone to leave a place
run off.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Someone tried to run me off the road.
Smith had run them off his property with a rifle.
run off.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to write a speech, poem, piece of music etc quickly and easily
run off.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: He could run off a five-page essay in an hour.
run off.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to get rid of weight or energy by running
run off.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I’m trying to run off some of the calories in that chocolate cake!
run off.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a second competition or election that is arranged when there is no clear winner of the first one
run off.translation[1].definitions[1].de: rain or other liquid that flows off the land into rivers
run off.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to quickly print several copies of something
run off.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Can you run off a couple of copies of this report?
run off.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: It was just before Christmas and all the sales staff were run off their feet.
